title: The Masked Singer Australia: Jackie O reveals the huge changes coming season two
text:
Channel 10 recently confirmed The Masked Signer Australia would be returning to screens in 2020.

Now it seems the network wants to step up the show's game for the new season.

Speaking on her KIIS FM's Kyle and Jackie O show, Masked Singer judge Jackie 'O' Henderson said that season two is already in the works - along with huge changes.

Big changes: Jackie 'O' Henderson revealed huge changes will be coming to season two of The Masked Singer. Speaking on The Kyle and Jackie O show on Tuesday, she shared that tentative filming dates have already been set for the next year

The 44-year-old explained that tentative filming dates have already been set for the next year, and that one of the biggest changes anticipated for the show is harder cryptic clues.

'We want to make the clues more cryptic because we feel that maybe we kind of got too many of them,' she explained to her listeners on Tuesday morning.

Ready for season two! The big changes anticipated for the next season is making the cryptic clues harder, and the cast of masked singers a more diverse group of celebrities. All the judges Jackie O, Lindsay Lohan, Dave Hughes and Dannii Minogue - were confirmed to return

She also added that they want to cast a far more varied group of celebrities.

'You want stars that I think you would never expect to be on a show like that or you didn't know could sing,' she added.

This comes after all the current Masked Singer Australia judges - Jackie O, Lindsay Lohan, Dave Hughes and Dannii Minogue - were confirmed to return for season two earlier this month.

Revealed! Monday night's episode of The Masked Singer saw all the final three performers unmasked. In third place was The Monster was revealed to be The Project's Gorgi Coghlan

Unmasked: Former Australian Idol winner and Neighbours actor Rob Mills was revealed to be The Wolf

Monday night's episode of The Masked Singer saw all the final three performers unmasked.

In third place was The Monster, who was revealed to be The Project's Gorgi Coghlan.

Former Australian Idol winner and Neighbours actor Rob Mills was revealed to be The Wolf, while the winner was The Robot, who unmasked himself as Cody Simpson.
description: Channel 10 recently confirmed The Masked Signer Australia would be returning to screens in 2020.
authors: Alisha Buaya For Daily Mail Australia
